message.content:
cs.DC, cs.OS, cs.PL, cs.PF, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is the most likely category as the paper presents a parallel for-loop scheduler that can be integrated into OpenMP implementations and measures its performance on different hardware systems.
- cs.OS (Operating Systems) is also likely as the paper discusses the use of POSIX signals for interrupting idle threads and work-stealing principles.
- cs.PL (Programming Languages) is another possible category as the paper describes how a user can manually replace OpenMP parallel for-loops with the proposed Interrupt-Driven Work-Sharing scheme in existing C++ applications.
- cs.PF (Performance) is relevant as the paper measures the performance of the proposed scheduler using both synthetic benchmarks and a real-life application.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is less likely but still possible as the paper presents a new scheduling algorithm for parallel for-loops.
